Classes

class  FormListener

Detailed Description

This class represents the JDialog used to modify the program's preferences, such as
  • The scraper used to extract the features (terms) from documents.
  • The metric used to calculate the distance between documents.
  • Etc...

Author:
Salvo Danilo Giuffrida (salvod.giuffrida@gmail.com)

void documentclassifier.PreferencesDialog.updatePreference ( String  preferenceName,
String  defaultValue,
String  updatedValue 
) [private]

This method updates the value of the preference specified in the 1st parameter with the new value, specified in the 3rd parameter, if it's different from the current value.

Parameters:
preferenceName The name of the preference whose value must be updated.
defaultValue Its default value.
updatedValue The new value that must be assigned to it.

Definition at line 589 of file PreferencesDialog.java.

00592             preferences.put(preferenceName, updatedValue);
00593         }
00594     }

void documentclassifier.PreferencesDialog.initializeInterface ( boolean  reset  )  [private]

This method is called during initialization of the GUI, each time that the user decides to open this JDialog, clicking on the menù item 'Modify'->'Preferences' in the menù bar.

It initializes the various components of the GUI, using the values of the various preferences, read from the class DocumentClassifierApp, which represents the application's core.

Parameters:
reset Boolean value, which indicates if the components of the GUI must be (re)initialized with the preferences' default values, or if instead with their current values.

The FocusListeners bound to some elements of the GUI are temporarly disabled.

The properties of the GUI's elements are set.

The FocusListeners are re-enabled.

void documentclassifier.PreferencesDialog.browse ( java.awt.event.ActionEvent  evt  )  [private]

This method is called each time that a JFileDialog must be opened, to select a file or directory from the filesystem.

Parameters:
evt 

Definition at line 816 of file PreferencesDialog.java.

00816                                                     {//GEN-FIRST:event_browse
00817     try {
00818         JFileChooser fileChooser = new JFileChooser();
00819         Object source=evt.getSource();
00820         boolean isTrainingSet = source.equals(buttonBrowseTrainingSetDirectory);
00821         boolean isStopwordsList=source.equals(buttonBrowseStopWords);
00822         if (isTrainingSet) {
00823             fileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY);
00824             fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory(new File(trainingSetDirectory).getParentFile());
00825         } else if (isStopwordsList) {
00826             fileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.FILES_ONLY);
00827             fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory(new File(stopWordsList).getParentFile());
00828             fileChooser.removeChoosableFileFilter(fileChooser.getAcceptAllFileFilter());
00829             fileChooser.setFileFilter(new FileFilter() {
00830 
00831                 @Override
00832                 public boolean accept(File arg) {
00833                     if (arg.getName().toLowerCase().endsWith(".txt") || arg.isDirectory()) {
00834                         return true;
00835                     } else {
00836                         return false;
00837                     }
00838                 }
00839 
00840                 @Override
00841                 public String getDescription() {
00842                     return preferencesDialogResources.getString("JFileChooser.textFileType");
00843                 }
00844             });
00845         } else {
00846             fileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY);
00847             fileChooser.setCurrentDirectory((new File(logFile).getParentFile()));
00848         }
00849         if (fileChooser.showOpenDialog(this) == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
00850             String newPath = fileChooser.getSelectedFile().getCanonicalPath();
00851             if (isTrainingSet && application.generateTrainingSet(newPath)) {
00852                 fieldTrainingSetDirectory.setText(newPath);
00853                 checkPath(new FocusEvent(fieldTrainingSetDirectory, FocusEvent.FOCUS_LOST));
00854             } else if (isStopwordsList) {
00855                 fieldStopWords.setText(newPath);
00856                 checkPath(new FocusEvent(fieldStopWords, FocusEvent.FOCUS_LOST));
00857             } else {
00858                 fieldLogFile.setText(newPath);
00859             }
00860         }
00861     } catch (Exception ex) {
00862         DocumentClassifierView.showErrorMessage(ex.toString());
00863     }
00864 }//GEN-LAST:event_browse

void documentclassifier.PreferencesDialog.checkPath ( java.awt.event.FocusEvent  evt  )  [private]

This method is called each time that the path specified in one of the JTextFields is modified by the user, and it controls if the new value is valid, that is, if it represents:

  • A valid stopwords file or
  • A valid training set directory

Parameters:
evt The FocusEvent generated by the change of focus by one of the JTextFields of the GUI.

If the new value is not valid, the field that has been checked is reset to its previous value, which instead is supposed to be valid.

Definition at line 883 of file PreferencesDialog.java.

00883                                                       {//GEN-FIRST:event_checkPath
00884 
00885     JTextField referenceField = (JTextField) evt.getSource();
00886     String oldPath;
00887     boolean isTrainingSet = (referenceField == fieldTrainingSetDirectory);
00888     if (isTrainingSet) {
00889         oldPath = trainingSetDirectory;
00890     } else {
00891         oldPath = stopWordsList;
00892     }
00893     String newPath = referenceField.getText();
00894     if (!newPath.equals(oldPath)) {
00895         try {
00896             if (isTrainingSet) {
00897                 //Check of the training set directory
00898                 if (application.generateTrainingSet(newPath)) {
00899                     trainingSetDirectory = newPath;
00900                     sliderKNN.setMaximum(application.getKNNMaximum());
00901                     sliderKNNMaximum.setMaximum(sliderKNN.getMaximum());
00902                     sliderKFold.setMaximum(application.getKFoldMaximum());
00903                 } else {
00904                     DocumentClassifierView.showErrorMessage(preferencesDialogResources.getString("messages.invalidTrainingSet"));
00905                     referenceField.setText(oldPath);
00906                 }
00907             } else {
00908                 //Check of the file with the list of stopwords
00909                 if (new File(newPath).isFile()) {
00910                     stopWordsList = newPath;
00911                 } else {
00912                     DocumentClassifierView.showErrorMessage(preferencesDialogResources.getString("messages.invalidStopWords"));
00913                     referenceField.setText(oldPath);
00914                     if(!(new File(oldPath).isFile())) {
00915                         checkBoxStopWords.setEnabled(false);
00916                     }
00917                 }
00918             }
00919         } catch (Exception ex) {
00920             DocumentClassifierView.showErrorMessage(ex.toString());
00925             referenceField.setText(oldPath);
00926         }
00927     }
00928 }//GEN-LAST:event_checkPath

void documentclassifier.PreferencesDialog.fixKFold ( javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent  evt  )  [private]

This method does two things: 1 - Fixes the value of K-Fold, each time that the user enables or disables stratified partitioning. 2 - Fixes the maximum allowed value of K-NN for validation, each time that the user modifies the value of K-Fold.

These two tasks are necessary, because:

1 - If stratification is enabled, the set of possible values for K-Fold is restricted, depending on the number of elements of each category of the training set that must be present in each fold.

2 - Analogously, if the user modifies the value of K-Fold (using the appropriate JSlider), the dimension of the current training set at each step changes proportionally, therefore also the maximum allowed value of K-NN changes in accordance.

Parameters:
evt 

Definition at line 948 of file PreferencesDialog.java.

00948                                                          {//GEN-FIRST:event_fixKFold
00949     
00950     int currentKFold = sliderKFold.getValue();
00951     int trainingSetSize=application.getTrainingSetSize();
00952     if (checkBoxStratified.isSelected()) {
00953         final int numberCategories = application.getTrainingSet().size();
00954         Map<Integer, Integer> possibleKFolds = new HashMap<Integer, Integer>();
00955         Entry<Integer, Integer> minimumDistance = new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<Integer,Integer>(0, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
00956         int i = 1;
00957         int possibleKFold, currentDistance;
00958         possibleKFold = trainingSetSize / (numberCategories * i);
00959         sliderKFold.setMaximum(possibleKFold);
00960         while (possibleKFold > sliderKFold.getMinimum()) {
00961             if (!possibleKFolds.containsKey(possibleKFold)) {
00962                 currentDistance = Math.abs(possibleKFold - currentKFold);
00963                 possibleKFolds.put(possibleKFold, currentDistance);
00964                 if (currentDistance < minimumDistance.getValue()) {
00965                     minimumDistance = new AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<Integer,Integer>(possibleKFold, currentDistance);
00966                 }
00967             }
00968             i++;
00969             possibleKFold = trainingSetSize / (numberCategories * i);
00970         }
00971         int newKFold=minimumDistance.getKey();
00972         sliderKFold.setValue(newKFold);
00973         sliderKNNMaximum.setMaximum((trainingSetSize/newKFold/numberCategories)*numberCategories*(currentKFold-1));
00974     } else {
00975         sliderKFold.setMaximum(application.getKFoldMaximum());
00976         sliderKNNMaximum.setMaximum((trainingSetSize/currentKFold)*(currentKFold-1));
00977     }
00978 }//GEN-LAST:event_fixKFold
